intro: Ranunculus cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Cuba. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers with five to eight petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with trifoliate leaves that are palmately arranged. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive yellow center and a white or greenish ring. Ranunculus cubensis prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, woodland areas.
